❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️❤️️ with the cooler season upon us a warm and cozy hat like the ehdc between stitches crochet beanie is perfect especially with a textured stitch that is simple enough for a beginner crocheter but also an enjoyable project for advanced crocheters this crochet pattern is available in 5 sizes a video tutorial is available for this hat https //youtu be/0zcvy3rp1z4 1 i m honored to be participating in the crochet cancer hat challenge again this year hosted by christine of sweet potato 3 2 this pattern will be featured on october 6th **crochet hook ** 5 0 mm h furls crochet hook 3 **notions ** removable stitch marker 4 yarn needle to weave in ends 5 scissors 6 pompom 7 **yarn ** wecrochet city tweed 8 aran/hw weight 55% merino wool 25% superfine alpaca 20% donegal tweed 164 yds/150m 100g shown in colorways obsidian and harbor seal 1 ball for all sizes **yardage ** 95 yds - 150 yds **abbreviations/stitches ** blo - back loop only chain - chain ehdc - extended half_double_crochet 9 slip_stitch - slip_stitch stsc - stacked single_crochet 10 st s -stitch es **gauge** 14 sts by 8 row = 4x4 in ehdc **measurements/sizes ** head circumference newborn 13-14 33-36 cm baby 16-17 41-43 cm toddler 18-19 46-48 cm child/small adult 20-21 51-53 cm adult 22-23 56-58 cm **skill level ** easy/beginner the pattern on the blog the free version of this
